intro: Rohdea henryi var. tsinlingensis, commonly known as the Tsingling rohdea, is a rare and ornamental plant native to China. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers, and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often variegated with silver or white markings. It produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in the spring. Due to its rarity and aesthetic appeal, it is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists.
